td.content: s:pt presents with severe cough for more than 11 days. she is a 30 yo female numismatist. o:Height 60 in, Weight 204 lbs, Temperature 98 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, Chest X-Ray shows right lower lobe infiltrate and abcess formation, rales Bil, mild rhonchi, crackles-LL, CTA-LL, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = diffuse tenderness, BS (+), no hepatosplenomegaly, Skin = decreased tugor a:Pneumonia p:administered amoxicillin-clavulanate - 2 g 2 x day, performed Chest X-Ray, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:pt presents with 5 months history of moderate recurrent bifrontal headaches. she is a white f aged 30 yrs. Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol Patient does not smoke o:Height 61 in, Weight 205 lbs, Temperature 98 F, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 16 a:Migraine Headaches p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to otorhinolaryngology.

s:pt presents with mild menorrhagia, mild easy bruising and mild non pruritic rash. These symptoms are present for about 2 weeks. patient is a 30 yo F. Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol she denies ever using cigarettes o:Height 60 in, Weight 204 lbs, Temperature 98 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed dexamethasone - 40 mg daily x 4 days, and ordered CBC.

td.content: s:female numismatist aged 31 ys complains of severe cough, severe chest pain and severe fever. NKDA. Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol Denies ever using tobacco o:Height 60 in, Weight 200 lbs, Temperature 98.5 F, Pulse 65, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 15, Chest X-Ray shows right lower lobe infiltrate and abcess formation, rales Bil, mild rhonchi, crackles-LL, CTA-LL, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = diffuse tenderness, BS (+), no hepatosplenomegaly, Skin = decreased tugor a:Pneumonia p:administered clarithromycin - 250 mg 2xday, performed Chest X-Ray, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:pt presents with moderate recurrent bifrontal headaches. patient also reports moderate phonophobia, moderate photophobia. patient is a white female numismatist aged 31 years. o:Height 61 in, Weight 205 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 66, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 16 a:Migraine Headaches p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed valproic acid - 250 mg 2 x daily, and ordered ESR.

s:31 YO f numismatist presents with mild easy bruising, mild non pruritic rash and mild menorrhagia. she denies drinking alcohol she does not smoke o:Height 61 in, Weight 207 lbs, Temperature 98.8 F, Pulse 66, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed prednisone - 1 mg/kg daily, and ordered CBC.
